properties.name: chaos.cpu-burner.enabled
properties.description: Whether the CPU burner job should start.

properties.name: chaos.cpu-burner.step
properties.description: A decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0 that defines the increased load at each iteration.

properties.name: chaos.cpu-burner.duration
properties.description: The duration (in ms) between each iteration (i.e. how much time the load is maintained at every cycle.

properties.name: chaos.fio-burner.enabled
properties.description: Whether the Fio burner job should start.

properties.name: chaos.fio-burner.max-files
properties.description: The number of files we'll eventually create.

properties.name: chaos.fio-burner.file-size
properties.description: The size (in MB) for each file to create.

properties.name: chaos.fio-burner.throughput
properties.description: The amount of data (in MB/s) we write in the files each second. This is limited by the host capability.

properties.name: chaos.pid-burner.enabled
properties.description: Whether the PID burner job should start.

properties.name: chaos.pid-burner.max-threads
properties.description: The number of threads to eventually spawn.

properties.name: chaos.pid-burner.duration
properties.description: The duration (in ms) between each thread spawn.

properties.name: chaos.ram-burner.enabled
properties.description: Whether the RAM burner job should start.

properties.name: chaos.ram-burner.max-memory
properties.description: The maount of memory to eventually load.

properties.name: chaos.ram-burner.duration
properties.description: The duration (in ms) between each new memory load.
